answers.answer: Hi there.  This pulling sensation could be a muscle cramp secondary to various causes like dehydration and dyselectrolytemia, plantar fasciitis,an overstretched muscle, medications like diuretics, statins, cellulitis, arthritis or gout, nerve damage as in diabetics, smokers and alcoholics, osteomyelitis or corticosteroids use. Certain steps to be taken are rest, leg elevation, ice application for about 15 minutes for 4 times a day, stretch and massage cramping muscles. over the counter pain medications, leg elevation and elastic bandages for varicose veins, nerve disorders or claudication, control diabetes, eliminate alcohol etc. You need to show yourself to a neurologist  and who would do the needful examination and clinical investigations. Take care.

question: This evening I developed an odd sensation in my left foot. Its on the top of the foot between the toes upwards. It feels like an actual "contraction". It feels like something is trying to move or push through my foot. I haven't banged it and it isnt painful but is annoying and has lasted for several hours now. Any ideas?????
title: Odd Contracting sensation on top of left foot???
